title.value: Inter- and intra-year forest change detection and monitoring of aboveground biomass dynamics using Sentinel-2 and Landsat
title.justification: The title is clearly stated at the beginning of the article, describing the focus on forest change detection and biomass monitoring using satellite data.
title.quote: Inter- and intra-year forest change detection and monitoring of aboveground biomass dynamics using Sentinel-2 and Landsat

extractions.description: The paper presents a study on forest change detection and biomass monitoring in Canada using Sentinel-2 and Landsat satellite data. It introduces the TIIC algorithm for near-real-time tracking of stand-replacing forest changes and quantifies AGB dynamics within the 2019 growing season. The study highlights the integration of satellite data for improved temporal accuracy in detecting forest disturbances.

type.justification: The paper involves empirical research, evident from the application and validation of the TIIC algorithm using real satellite data to monitor forest changes and biomass dynamics.
type.quote: Amidst changing patterns of forest disturbances, satellite remote sensing has been uniquely positioned to offer spatially extensive continuous monitoring of forests at temporal and spatial resolutions that are relevant for management.

name.justification: The primary field of the study is remote sensing, primarily using data from Sentinel-2 and Landsat for forest change detection.
name.quote: Amidst changing patterns of forest disturbances, satellite remote sensing has been uniquely positioned to offer spatially extensive continuous monitoring of forests at temporal and spatial resolutions that are relevant for management.

name.justification: The paper focuses on monitoring forest biomass dynamics, which is a subfield of remote sensing applied to forestry.
name.quote: To demonstrate the utility of the within-year change outputs generated using TIIC, we investigated intra-year AGB dynamics.

name.justification: The study introduces and validates the TIIC algorithm for detecting changes in forest cover using satellite data.
name.quote: Inter- and intra-year forest change detection and monitoring of aboveground biomass dynamics using Sentinel-2 and Landsat

name.justification: The TIIC algorithm is explicitly mentioned and described as a new approach for change detection developed in this paper.
name.quote: We developed an algorithm that leverages these spatially and spectrally compatible data sources, called Tracking Intra- and Inter-year Change (TIIC), to monitor forest change.

is_contributed.justification: TIIC is directly mentioned as a novel contribution of this study for monitoring forest changes.
is_contributed.quote: We developed an algorithm... called Tracking Intra- and Inter-year Change (TIIC)

is_executed.justification: The execution of TIIC involves processing large amounts of satellite data, which typically requires computational power available through satellites and cloud computing, implying execution on available computing infrastructure.
is_executed.quote: Dense time series of Landsat and Sentinel-2 images processed with cloud computing technologies have allowed for this spatially extensive and temporally fine analysis.

is_compared.justification: TIIC’s efficacy is compared with other algorithms like S-CCD and COLD in terms of time taken to detect changes.
is_compared.quote: This time lag suggests a shorter period to detect change than NRT algorithms such as S-CCD (Ye et al., 2021) and COLD (Zhu et al., 2020).

referenced_paper_title.value: Multi-sensor change detection for within-year capture and labelling of forest disturbance
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper is included in the context of discussing multi-sensor data use, aligning with change detection methodologies like TIIC.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Multi-sensor change detection for within-year capture and labelling of forest disturbance.

name.justification: The VLCE dataset provides the land cover map used for delineating treed areas in the study.
name.quote: The Canada-wide, 30-m, land cover map used to delineate the treed mask was produced with the Virtual Land Cover Engine (VLCE).

referenced_paper_title.value: Disturbance-informed annual land cover classification maps of Canada’s forested ecosystems for a 29-year Landsat time series
referenced_paper_title.justification: This reference is related to the VLCE framework used in the study for land cover classification.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Disturbance-informed annual land cover classification maps of Canada’s forested ecosystems for a 29-year Landsat time series.

name.justification: Google Earth Engine is utilized as a platform for processing satellite images for the analysis.
name.quote: As available on Google Earth Engine (Gorelick et al., 2017).

referenced_paper_title.value: Google Earth Engine: planetary-scale geospatial analysis for everyone
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper describes Google Earth Engine, aligning with its use in processing the satellite data for this study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Google Earth Engine: planetary-scale geospatial analysis for everyone.

name.justification: Matasci et al. (2018) dataset is used for generating spatially-explicit maps of forest structures and acts as a baseline for analysis.
name.quote: The AGB data used in this analysis stemmed from the protocol outlined in Matasci et al. (2018b).

referenced_paper_title.value: Large-area mapping of Canadian boreal forest cover, height, biomass and other structural attributes using Landsat composites and lidar plots
referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset from this referenced paper provides essential inputs for the analysis performed in the study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Large-area mapping of Canadian boreal forest cover, height, biomass and other structural attributes using Landsat composites and lidar plots.

name.justification: The s2cloudless algorithm is used for cloud masking in Sentinel-2 images during analysis.
name.quote: ...while the s2cloudless algorithm was used for Sentinel-2 images to remove cloudy pixels based on cloud probability images.

referenced_paper_title.value: More accurate and flexible cloud masking for Sentinel-2 images
referenced_paper_title.justification: The mentioned reference discusses the s2cloudless algorithm relevant to its use in this study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: More accurate and flexible cloud masking for Sentinel-2 images.
